briefdescription.para: Initializes a new instance of the Table class.

detaileddescription.para: When Table is created, it belongs to the specified document, but is not yet part of the document and ParentNode is null.
To append Table to the document use InsertAfter or InsertBefore on the story where you want the table inserted.

briefdescription.para: Accepts a visitor.

detaileddescription.para: Enumerates over this node and all of its children. Each node calls a corresponding method on DocumentVisitor.
For more info see the Visitor design pattern.

briefdescription.para: Resizes the table and cells according to the specified auto fit behavior.

detaileddescription.para: This method mimics the commands available in the Auto Fit menu for a table in Microsoft Word. The commands available are "Auto Fit to Contents", "Auto Fit to Window" and "Fixed Column Width". In Microsoft Word these commands set relevant table properties and then update the table layout and Aspose.Words does the same for you.

briefdescription.para: Removes all table and cell borders on this table.
Removes all shading on the table.
Converts cells horizontally merged by width to cells merged by HorizontalMerge.

detaileddescription.para: Table cells can be horizontally merged either using merge flags HorizontalMerge or using cell width Width.
When table cell is merged by width property HorizontalMerge is meaningless but sometimes having merge flags is more convenient way.
Use this method to transforms table cells horizontally merged by width to cells merged by merge flags.

briefdescription.para: If the table has no rows, creates and appends one Row.
Gets or sets absolute horizontal floating table position specified by the table properties, in points. Default value is 0.
Gets or sets absolute vertical floating table position specified by the table properties, in points. Default value is 0.
Specifies how an inline table is aligned in the document.

detaileddescription.para: The default value is Left.

briefdescription.para: Allows Microsoft Word and Aspose.Words to automatically resize cells in a table to fit their contents.

detaileddescription.para: The default value is true.

briefdescription.para: Gets or sets the "Allow spacing between cells" option.
Gets whether a floating table shall allow other floating objects in the document to overlap its extents when displayed. Default value is true.
Gets or sets whether this is a right-to-left table.

detaileddescription.para: When true, the cells in this row are laid out right to left.
The default value is false.

briefdescription.para: Gets or sets the amount of space (in points) to add below the contents of cells.
Gets or sets the amount of space (in points) between the cells.
Gets or sets description of this table. It provides an alternative text representation of the information contained in the table.

detaileddescription.para: The default value is an empty string.
This property is meaningful for ISO/IEC 29500 compliant DOCX documents (OoxmlCompliance). When saved to pre-ISO/IEC 29500 formats, the property is ignored.

briefdescription.para: Gets distance between table bottom and the surrounding text, in points.
Gets distance between table left and the surrounding text, in points.
Gets distance between table right and the surrounding text, in points.
Gets distance between table top and the surrounding text, in points.
Returns the first Row node in the table.
Gets the base object from which the horizontal positioning of floating table should be calculated. Default value is Column.
Returns the last Row node in the table.
Gets or sets the value that represents the left indent of the table.
Gets or sets the amount of space (in points) to add to the left of the contents of cells.
Returns NodeType.Table.
Gets or sets the table preferred width.

detaileddescription.para: The default value is Auto.

briefdescription.para: Gets or sets floating table relative horizontal alignment.
Gets or sets floating table relative vertical alignment.
Gets or sets the amount of space (in points) to add to the right of the contents of cells.
Provides typed access to the rows of the table.
Gets or sets the table style applied to this table.
Gets or sets the locale independent style identifier of the table style applied to this table.
Gets or sets the name of the table style applied to this table.
Gets or sets bit flags that specify how a table style is applied to this table.
Gets or sets TextWrapping for table.
Gets or sets title of this table. It provides an alternative text representation of the information contained in the table.

detaileddescription.para: The default value is an empty string.
This property is meaningful for ISO/IEC 29500 compliant DOCX documents (OoxmlCompliance). When saved to pre-ISO/IEC 29500 formats, the property is ignored.

briefdescription.para: Gets or sets the amount of space (in points) to add above the contents of cells.
Gets the base object from which the vertical positioning of floating table should be calculated. Default value is Margin.
Setter for Aspose::Words::Tables::Table::get_AbsoluteHorizontalDistance.
Setter for Aspose::Words::Tables::Table::get_AbsoluteVerticalDistance.

Setter for Aspose::Words::Tables::Table::get_LeftPadding.
Setter for Aspose::Words::Tables::Table::get_PreferredWidth.
Setter for Aspose::Words::Tables::Table::get_RelativeHorizontalAlignment.
Setter for Aspose::Words::Tables::Table::get_RelativeVerticalAlignment.
Setter for Aspose::Words::Tables::Table::get_RightPadding.

memberdef.argsstring: (Aspose::Words::BorderType borderType, Aspose::Words::LineStyle lineStyle, double lineWidth, System::Drawing::Color color, bool isOverrideCellBorders)
memberdef.name: SetBorder

briefdescription.para: Sets the specified table border to the specified line style, width and color.
Sets all table borders to the specified line style, width and color.
Sets shading to the specified values on whole table.
Represents a table in a Word document.

detaileddescription.para: Table is a block-level node and can be a child of classes derived from Story or InlineStory.
Table can contain one or more Row nodes.
A minimal valid table needs to have at least one Row.
